head.supplied: ¶ Let me offer my gratulation, dear Chev. ¶ Archer, to your election into the L. S. ¶ You have never yet replied to my question, whether anything ¶ is expected from me concerning the answers to Ea...

div.p: 2/137/9, Archer papers, University of Melbourne Archives.

Archer was elected FLS on 5 November 1874. Since M set out on the journey mentioned in the postscript to this letter on 15 February 1875 (see M to T. Ware, 14 February 1875 [In this edition as 75-02-14d]), it would seem that the letter was written during the second week of February 1875.
Let me offer my gratulation, dear Chev.
i. e. Chevalier. This presumably refers to the papal decoration of Gregory the Great bestowed on Archer in 1870. Archer, to your election into the L. S.
Linnean Society, London. You have never yet replied to my question, whether anything
this might be two words - check. M often has it as two words.
is expected from me concerning the answers to Earl Carnarvons question about timber &c. Those questions coming to me only long after their arrival and after being attended to by the forest board,
explain.
I looked upon myself as post
festum , and all the more as the forest board seemed mainly to wish referring only to my printed work. Yet there may be a misunderstanding on the subject, but as I do not know how far the Board has answered the questions, it would be a waste of much valuable time, if I did over again what may have been done by you & your colleagues

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
I wished you could give me a call, but next week I shall be engaged in a professional journey through some ranges beyond [Dandenong].
See n. 1 above.
